Suppose $p$ and $q=1-p$ are respectively the probabilities of winning and losing a round of some game.

From @churvich_ce_statub103_lec13, assuming that each round is either won or lost the probability that at least one losing streak of length
$r$ will occur somewhere among $n$ independent rounds of the game is approximately $[1+(nâˆ’r)p]q^{r}$


```{pyodide}
n = 100 # number of rounds of the game
r = 10 # length of losing streak
p = 0.6 # probability of win
q = 1-p # probability of loss
prob = (1 + (n-r)*p)*(q**r)
print(f'The probability of at least one losing streak of length {r} somewhere among {n} independent rounds of the game is approximately {prob:1.4%}')
```
